stockinette = 10 cm / 4 inch needles dpns or circular needle in size 2 5 mm / us 1 5 or size needed to get gauge sizes 36/37/38/39 60 sts 40/41/42/43 68 sts stitch abbreviations are listed on page 6 together with the charts pattern instructions both sizes are knit the same way if the stitch count varies for the different sizes sizes 40/41/42/43 are marked in brackets and highlighted in blue like so 1 please note that there are two different charts make sure you are always following the correct chart for your size follow the same instructions for the right and left sock cuff co 60 68 st in the round divide stitches evenly on circular needles using magic loop method 30 34 stitches per needle or on dpns 15 17 stitches per needle place marker between the last and the first stitch row 1 *p1 k1* repeat until the end of round row 2 *p1 k1tbl* repeat until the end of round repeat row 2 an additional 13 15 times for a total of 15 17 rnds or until you reach your desired length for the cuff leg knit the next rounds following the chart for your size on page 6 starting with row 1 you can choose to knit the chart over all 60 68 stitches as it was done in the yellow sample here or you can knit the chart only over the first 30 34 stitches and simply knit all other stitches plain stockinette as shown in the light blue version continue knitting following the chart until you reach your desired length for the leg i recommend between 13-15 cm 2 heel you can choose again between two options the yellow sample is knit with a german short row heel the light blue sample is knit with a reinforced heel flap heel turn and gusset you can of course knit any other type of heel you prefer measurements for the length of the foot are provided below heel option 1 german short row heel row 1 rs knit 30 34 stitches following the chart then knit 30 34 more stitches use two stitch markers and divide the stitches in three equal parts 10/10/10 12/10/12 the markers stay in place and will simply be slipped as you knit across them row 2 ws make one double stitch mds and purl across row 3 rs mds then knit across to right before the double stitch do not knit the double stitch turn work around row 4 ws mds
